title: Before 1 January 2018, will Russia and Egypt sign an agreement to establish a Russian industrial zone on the Suez Canal?
preds: It is being discussed.  There is growing support for Iran from Russia and the nature of Russian support comes with a price tag.
Will probably be signed in January.

Sisi said the two leaders had also discussed industrial projects, trade and Russian investments in Egypt, including in the Suez Canal Economic Zone.
https://www.reuters.com/article/us-egypt-russia/putin-egypts-sisi-discuss-restart-of-flights-sign-nuclear-deal-idUSKBN1E51BR
________________________________
COMMENT:  OK, they discussed it. That means that nothing will be done before january.
I may not be able to update this, so I'm going to the max.
Conflicting news, announcement was probably in error. http://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/640233
I'm flipping my forecast because I can find only one reference to a signed contract (in Egypt Independent).

http://www.egyptindependent.com/russian-industrial-zone-construction-works-begin-2018-sca-chairman/ In a December 14th article in the Egypt Independent there is reference to a signed contract, but I find no other reference to such, which makes me wonder if the Egypt Independent got it wrong.

https://www.egypttoday.com/Article/3/36744/What-you-need-to-know-about-Russian-Industrial-Zone-in 13 December 2017: Egypt and Russia have been negotiating a $7 billion worth of Russian investment in an industrial zone in the East Port Said region, with a final agreement set be finalized soon. 
~~~~~~~
https://dailynewsegypt.com/2017/12/13/first-phase-russian-industrial-zone-implementation-starting-next-month/ Dec 13th. The Suez Canal Economic Zone (SCZone) has revealed the details of establishing a Russian industrial zone in East Port Said. . . . the Russian industrial zone will be established on an area of 5.2 sqkm,. . . . the implementation of the Russian zone will begin next month . . .  a joint company between the SCZone and the Russian industrial developer will be launched to manage and operate the zone. Mohab Mamish, chairperson of the Suez Canal Authority, said that the initial implementation phases will start next month. The economic zone is receiving a delegation from the Russian industrial developer, Technopolis Moscow, to showcase the companies planning to be present in the area and to determine a final legal framework for the company, as well as the percentages and types of Egyptian and foreign labour for the project.
~~~~~~
http://www.egyptindependent.com/russian-industrial-zone-construction-works-begin-2018-sca-chairman/ Dec 14: Mamish added that the Egyptian and Russian governments signed a contract to construct the industrial zone on a five km squared area, . . . Mamish clarified, adding that Egyptians must represent 90 percent of the workforce in every project or industrial complex inside the industrial zone.
~~~~~~
COMMENT:  It sounds to me like between the 13th and the 14th a contract was signed

December 14, 2017 Chairman of the Suez Canal Authority (SCA) and the Suez Canal Economic Zone (SCZone), Mohab Mamish, said in press statements on Wednesday that construction of the Russian Industrial Zone will commence in early 2018.     Mamish added that the Egyptian and Russian governments signed a contract to construct the industrial zone on a five km squared area, with investments totaling $6.9 billion. The construction works will be carried out in three stages over 13 years. 
http://www.egyptindependent.com/russian-industrial-zone-construction-works-begin-2018-sca-chairman/ Cabinet reviews outcome of Putin's visit to Egypt
Thursday، 14 December 2017  The cabinet reviewed on Wednesday the outcome of a visit paid by Russian President Vladimir Putin to Egypt on Monday. During the visit, an agreement was reached to establish the Dabaa nuclear plant and a Russian industrial zone at the Suez Canal Economic Zone, Acting Premier and Housing Minister Mostafa Madbouly said.
http://www.sis.gov.eg/Story/121824?lang=en-us
I thought they would close the deal ASAP, but now it appears too late to do it before 2018. See @dsarin http://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/637962

Per  Raahul_Kumar Useful comments. 
With many thanks

https://www.egypttoday.com/Article/3/36439/Sisi-aims-for-more-Russian-investment-in-SCZone Sisi said the two leaders had also discussed industrial projects, trade and Russian investments in Egypt, including in the Suez Canal Economic Zone.

Negotiations are running out of time it would seem.
https://www.madamasr.com/en/2017/12/11/news/u/egypt-left-empty-handed-after-putin-visit/ If they're still honing the deal, it will hardly be finished let alone signed by end of year.
seems like they are a long way off from this being finalized
Rats, it looks like Putin & Sisi have not SIGNED anything yet on this.  The recent signing was for a nuclear project.

Is that a 'yes'? "During the visit, it was also clear that investments to create a Russian industrial zone in Egypt could reach $ 7 billion."
Source: http://www.europe.easybranches.com/bulgaria/Russia-will-Build-the-First-Nuclear-Power-Plant-in-Egypt-145002 I think it is: "The Egyptian and the Russian sides has agreed to attract Russian investments to Egypt through the establishment of a Russian industrial zone in the economic zone of the Suez Canal and agreed to assign ministers to remove any obstacles that might face the cooperation file, president Sisi said on Monday." Source: https://en.el-balad.com/2359519
Given its advanced status, the signing of the agreement may be conveniently a statement by Russia on its geopolitical position in the ME, especially following Trump's pro-Israeli Jerusalem statement
Considering I haven't been able to find any recent news on the question, I don't this this is happening this year.
Putin is making trip to Egypt shortly so I expect it will be to announce deal.

They still are working on a military cooperation agreement. I suspect this also signifies that they are taking their time on the industrial zone agreement, as well. See @dsarin's comment here http://www.gjopen.com/comments/comments/621270 Dateline 11-30-2017 - Russia’s government published a draft agreement between Russia and Egypt on Thursday allowing both countries to use each other’s air space and air bases for their military planes. The draft deal was set out in a decree, signed by Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev on Nov. 28, which ordered the Russian Defence Ministry to hold negotiations with Egyptian officials and to sign the document once both sides reached an agreement. Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu visited Cairo for talks with Egypt’s political and military leadership on Wednesday and the decree said the draft had been “preliminary worked through with the Egyptian side” and approved by Medvedev. -- https://www.reuters.com/article/us-russia-egypt-military-airspace-planes/russian-military-working-on-deal-to-use-egyptian-air-bases-document-idUSKBN1DU11D

During this meeting, a partnership was signed with the Ministry of Military Production to work on a project for the manufacture and supply of train locomotives produced by a Russian company for the Egyptian National Railways, as well as the establishment of the Russian industrial zone in East Port Said.
https://dailynewsegypt.com/2017/11/18/egyptian-russian-company-established-manufacture-machines-equipment-mills-silos-feed-complexes/ As the question itself indicates "Egypt and Russia are in discussions to establish a Russian industrial zone at Port Said on the Suez Canal"
Dropping down because everything I read says this is close. However I have been reading stories saying it is close for several months.

Egypt will sign contracts of the Russian industrial zone located in eastern Port Said in the New Suez Canal within days, the Suez Canal Economic Zone’s (SCZone) advisor Samir Abdel Shafi said on Monday. A residential area will be built in Ain Sokhna to house 600,000 people, in addition to establishing an industrial zone, Abdel Shafi added during the Intelligent Cities Exhibition and Conference 2017 (ICEC). Egypt’s trade minister Tarek Kabil said earlier this month that Egypt will sign the final agreement for setting up the Egyptian-Russian industrial zone in Egypt prior to the end of 2017.
https://english.mubasher.info/news/3175606/Egypt-to-ink-Russian-industrial-zone-deals-soon-Official Admiral Mohab Mamish, Chairman of  the Suez Canal Authority and Chairman of the Suez Canal Economic Zone  (SCZone), and  Sultan Ahmed Bin Sulayem, Group Chairman and CEO, DP World, today signed a  partnership agreement to develop an integrated industrial and residential zone at Sokhna in  Egypt, in the  presence  of  Sherif Ismail , the Prime Minister of Egypt. The  signing took place at a ceremony in  Sharm el - Sheikh at the World Youth Forum. The  agreement  will  establish a  joint venture  between SCZone  (51%)  and DP World (49%) with DP World  managing  the zone, which  is  projected to  start  in the first quarter of 2018.
http://en.portnews.ru/news/248536/
No news about a specific date yet. With six weeks until end-2017, signing in this time frame appears unlikely.

No chance. Russia is hopeless at this world stage stuff. USA and KSA still have Egypt in their palm. Everyone pat the li'l overrated African Muslim on the head, put him back in his place, safe in Trump's little hand.
Accounting for the passage of time, and thus a narrower window of opportunity.

The new Cold War between Russia and USA is really heating up. But the USA I believe still has Egypt on an economic leash and is holding tight. The USA is more of an economic powerhouse than Russia and Washington gives Egypt billions in aid each year. But relations between Egypt and the United States are not as strong as they were in the Obama years. Adding up all the factors I would say there is a 67% agreement the deal will be signed.

https://dailynewsegypt.com/2017/09/06/establishment-russian-industrial-zone-postponed-early-2018/ "From his part, Egyptian Minister of Industry and Trade Tarek Kabil said that negotiations with Russian and Dutch investors for the establishment of industrial zones at the Suez Canal area are continuing until now, and negotiations take a long time. Kabil told Daily News Egypt that the government, represented by the Ministry of Industry and Trade, will not grant preferential privileges to an investor at the expense of another investor. Kabil added that the ministry is currently conducting a new round of negotiations with the Russian side on the establishment of the Russian industrial zone. Comment: a new round of negotiations would likely go a few months and so doubting it will happen by the end of the year. I noticed much more specificity about the signing of contracts on the Dabaa nuclear reactor and in fact checking Putin's schedule over the next few months.  Four contracts will be signed by the end of the year outlining what each one will do.  http://www.energycentral.com/news/egypt-sign-contracts-dabaa-nuclear-power-plant-end-2017-minister
https://dailynewsegypt.com/2017/09/25/signing-dabaa-contracts-awaiting-putins-schedule/ My question is if there has already been a suggestion that there will be a delay because a new round of negotiations needs to happen so as not to disadvantage other investors (Dutch), then a few months more is likely because they are changing the contract. I'm guessing the whole thing could easily spill over into 2018 including the signing.  One big ceremony? Unsure about that part.

Is there a chance for this white elephant?  Yes.
But I need to compensate for me ignoring this question for a while.
The us will not let it happen
Nothing like this happens fast. The end of the year prediction is almost impossibly optimistic.

If signing is to happen in the 7 weeks until end-2017, we should see a specific date set within the next ten days at the latest.  Concluding such deals tend to take more time than originally estimated. Even after the big questions of substance are settled, many technical details remain to be agreed, and without a strong political push from the highest levels the discussions tend to drag on, as the mid-level officials are reluctant to take decisions they can be blamed about later. The news chatter does indicate that both sides are working on a deal, but I suspect the signing will occur in 2018.

The referenced articles certainly seem optimistic about the possibility, and I have no reason to think otherwise.  Given Russia's clear desire to regain its status as a major player in the Middle East, the historical support the USSR gave to Egypt, and the volume of trade between the two nations, there appears to be a great deal of incentive for the deal to get done. Not an absolute certainty, I don't think.  But I would say better than even odds.  I'll adjust downwards if time passes and there is no apparent progress.

Looks like everyone is in agreement, the goal is by year-end.  
https://af.reuters.com/article/africaTech/idAFL4N1ME2UT
Everything I have read suggests the agreement should be signed by the end of the year.  https://af.reuters.com/article/africaTech/idAFL4N1ME2UT

So it stands.

The volume of trade exchange between Egypt and Russia reached about $2.5 billion compared to $2.2 billion during the same period of last year, said Qabil, pointing out that Egyptian exports during the first seven months of this year amounted for $387.9 million compared to $304.6 million during the same period of last year with an increase rate of 27.3 percent, thus achieving the first sign of growth on Egyptian exports to the Russian market since 2014. This value exceeded the total volume of Egyptian exports to Russia for the year 2016, valued at $373.4 million Ongoing negotiations between the Egyptian and Russian government on the establishment of the Russian industrial zone in Egypt have made considerable progress and the two parties are close to signing the final contact on the project before the end of the year, Tariq Qabil, Minister of Trade and Industry, said
